text: Dendrocalamus is a tropical Asian genus of giant clumping bamboos in the grass family.Nees von Esenbeck, Christian Gottfried Daniel. 1835. Linnaea 9(4): 476–477 in LatinTropicos, Dendrocalamus Nees It is found in the Indian subcontinent, China, and Southeast Asia.Flora of China, Vol. 22 Page 39, 牡竹属 mu zhu shu Dendrocalamus Nees, Linnaea. 9: 476. 1835. Dendrocalamus giganteus is one of the tallest of bamboos, capable of reaching heights up to 46 m.Bamboos Of India, . Accessed 8 June 2007Bioone ;SpeciesThe Plant List search for Dendrocalamus ;formerly included see Ampelocalamus Bambusa Gigantochloa Neololeba Pseudoxytenanthera ==References== Category:Bambusoideae genera
title: Dendrocalamus
